intro: Pilogyne cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are often inconspicuous. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Pilogyne cuspidata is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental appeal in dry gardens.
